page.title: 19LANGUAGE ORIGINS
page.content: Our language has been build in layers and our words are all mixed together so often in a single sentence that we say words that come from different layers. {"MY MOTHER RECEIVED A GOOD TELEGRAM." {MOTHER}comes from an old word which is of Indo-European origin {RECEIVED}is of Latin origin {GOOD }is an old teutonic or Anglo- Saxon word {TELEGRAM}comes from Greek Teutonic words are the framework of our language. After the teutonic, the most important influences are from Latin or direct from French,Spanish or Italian. They are more polished and polite than teutonic words. The Normans who spoke French came over and conquered England and ruled over the Teutonic people and the Anglo-Saxons who lived here.
